abstract.p: Tina Georgeou, vice chairwoman for US unit of Optimedia International, owned by Publicis Groupe SA, is leaving to join Meredith Corp in post of vice president for corporate development; Joseph Fisher, who served as president and chief executive for US operations at Burson-Marsteller, is being replaced by Chet Burchett, who is being promoted from chairman for US brand marketing practice (S)

block.p: Two top executives are leaving agencies, one with another job and the other without.

Tina Georgeou, vice chairwoman for the United States unit of Optimedia International in New York, a media services agency owned by the Publicis Groupe S.A., is leaving to join the Meredith Corporation, which publishes magazines like Better Homes and Gardens and The Ladies' Home Journal, in the new post of vice president for corporate development. Ms. Georgeou, 48, will be based at the Meredith office in New York; the Meredith headquarters are in Des Moines.
Two top executives are leaving agencies, one with another job and the other without.

Tina Georgeou, vice chairwoman for the United States unit of Optimedia International in New York, a media services agency owned by the Publicis Groupe S.A., is leaving to join the Meredith Corporation, which publishes magazines like Better Homes and Gardens and The Ladies' Home Journal, in the new post of vice president for corporate development. Ms. Georgeou, 48, will be based at the Meredith office in New York; the Meredith headquarters are in Des Moines.

And Joseph Fisher, 53, who served for the last year as president and chief executive for United States operations at Burson-Marsteller -- the public relations agency that is owned by the Young & Rubicam unit of the WPP Group, -- is being replaced by Chet Burchett, 42, who is being promoted from chairman for the United States brand marketing practice.
Burson-Marsteller said that Mr. Fisher had ''decided to explore other opportunities within the Y.& R. family.'' Mr. Fisher was based in New York and Mr. Burchett is based in Chicago.
